resources.string: Chest Pain (Angina): Occurs during exertion or stress, alleviated by rest.
Shortness of Breath: Particularly noticeable during exertion or while lying down.\ Edema: Swelling in legs, ankles, and feet.\ Fatigue: Chronic tiredness and reduced exercise capacity.
Cardiovascular disease (CVD) symptoms can vary significantly between men and women, often leading to differences in diagnosis and treatment.
Women are more likely to experience non-traditional or atypical symptoms compared to men, which can sometimes delay recognition and treatment.
